title: Franny's Feet
synopsis: Franny Fantootsie tries on shoes brought to her grandfather's shop for repair, and each pair takes her on magical adventures all over the world. From tropical shores to the North Pole, Franny meets new people and animal friends with every step.
reasoning: This TV-Y rated show is highly educational, focusing on geography, culture, and problem-solving through gentle, imaginative adventures suitable for preschoolers. The content is consistently non-violent and free of scary or complex thematic elements, earning a 'Safe' rating.

title: Octonauts: Above & Beyond
synopsis: The Octonauts expand their exploration beyond the sea -- and onto land! With new rides and new friends, they'll protect any habitats and animals at risk.
reasoning: The show is rated TV-Y and maintains a positive, low-conflict structure centered around environmental education and animal rescue. title: Rocket Power
synopsis: The daily lives of four friends who enjoy extreme sports, surfing, and getting into some crazy situations.
reasoning: Rocket Power is highly stimulating due to its focus on fast-paced extreme sports action, frequent wipeouts, and competitive spirit. title: Quack Pack
synopsis: This cartoon follows on from the 1980’s cartoon “Ducktales”, continuing the adventures of Huey, Dewey and Louie. Now 12 year olds and living with their uncle Donald Duck, the three spend their time playing practical jokes on their hapless uncle and otherwise getting into trouble.
reasoning: This show receives a Caution rating due to its high-energy pacing and focus on moderate cartoon slapstick violence, chaos, and themes of teenage mischief and disobedience. It is appropriate for children aged 7 and older who can distinguish between high-octane cartoon violence and reality. The series contains no scary elements or LGBTQ+ representation.

title: 101 Dalmatian Street
synopsis: Follow the adventures of eldest siblings Dolly and Dylan, their Mum Delilah and Dad Doug, and their 97 younger brothers and sisters as they embark on urban adventures and extreme sibling rivalry. Together, the pups explore growing up and finding their own spot inside the biggest, messiest, furriest blended family ever.
reasoning: This show is rated TV-Y7, featuring fast-paced slapstick comedy centered on family dynamics and mild urban adventures. It contains frequent sibling rivalry and cartoon violence, but no frightening imagery or serious peril. The content promotes themes of teamwork and responsibility.

title: The Wonderful World of Mickey Mouse
synopsis: It's nothing but fun and excitement for Mickey and his best pals – Minnie, Donald, Daisy, Goofy and Pluto - as they embark on their greatest adventures yet, navigating the curveballs of a wild and zany world where the magic of Disney makes the impossible possible.

The series is suitable for all ages but may be overwhelming for infants due to the pace.

title: Magnum Opus
synopsis: Groot sets out to paint a family portrait of himself and the Guardians, only to discover just how messy the artistic process can be.
